ranges.notes: Public holiday. Many businesses closed. Cold winter weather.
Public holiday. Winter continues.
Coldest month, potential for snow. Fewer city tourists. Good time for museums, Ars Electronica Center. Nearby skiing possible in Mühlviertel.
Winter continues, cold but days start getting slightly longer. Carnival events may occur leading up to Ash Wednesday. Good for indoor cultural activities.

ranges.event: Easter Markets & Holy Week (if Easter falls in March/early April)
ranges.notes: Transition to spring. Temperatures rising but can still be chilly. Potential for early Easter markets. Pöstlingberg gardens start showing green. Fewer tourists than peak season.

ranges.event: Easter Markets, Easter Monday (Public Holiday - date varies), Linz Marathon
ranges.notes: Spring fully arrives. Pöstlingberg gardens are beautiful. Pleasant weather for city walks and Danube riverside activities. Outdoor cafes begin opening.
Public holiday. Generally pleasant spring weather.

ranges.event: Ascension Day, Whit Monday (Public Holidays - dates vary)
ranges.notes: Excellent month. Warm weather, lush greenery. Ideal for exploring the city, Danube riverside, and Pöstlingberg. Start of outdoor event season.
Start of summer. Warm, long days. Ideal for outdoor activities, visiting Pleschinger See, enjoying beer gardens. Cultural events begin.
Peak summer month. Warmest temperatures, can be hot and humid. Busy with tourists and festivals. Great for outdoor activities but expect crowds.
High summer season. Warm weather continues. Busy tourist period.
Public holiday. Peak summer tourism. Many locals may take vacation.
Late summer. Still warm, good for outdoor activities. Ars Electronica Festival preparation begins.

ranges.event: Ars Electronica Festival, Linz Klangwolke, Brucknerfest begins
ranges.notes: Often beautiful, sunny 'Indian summer' days. Ideal for city exploration, Danube riverside activities. Major cultural festivals in full swing.

ranges.event: Brucknerfest continues, Linz International Short Film Festival, Lange Nacht der Museen
ranges.notes: Autumn colors. Cooler but often pleasant weather. Good time for cultural events, museums, city walks. Mühlviertel wine region is beautiful.
Public holiday. Cultural events continue.
Late autumn. Days getting shorter and colder. Prepare for possibility of rain.
Public holiday. Quiet day, many businesses closed.
Often grey, cold, and potentially damp. Low tourist season. Good for indoor activities like museums and cafes.
Christmas market begins opening towards the end of the month, bringing a festive atmosphere despite the weather.
Full festive swing. Christmas markets are the main attraction. Cozy atmosphere. Book accommodation early.
Public holiday, but markets and some shops may be open due to Christmas shopping season. Very busy.
Magical time to visit for the festive atmosphere. Very popular, expect crowds.
Public holidays. Most things closed, including markets (some close early on 24th). Very quiet family time.
Inter-holiday period. Some visitors, city relatively quiet compared to pre-Christmas.
Celebrations in the city, often events on Hauptplatz. Restaurants booked out.

spring: Exploring Pöstlingberg gardens as they bloom
Walking or cycling along the Danube riverside
Enjoying outdoor cafes in the city center
summer: Attending festivals (Ars Electronica, Linz Festival, Klangwolke)
Exploring the city center and Urfahr district
Enjoying beer gardens along the Danube
autumn: Attending cultural festivals (Brucknerfest, Short Film Festival)
Visiting the Mühlviertel region (wine tasting, autumn colors)
Enjoying autumn colors in Pöstlingberg gardens
Exploring museums (Ars Electronica Center, Lentos, museums)
Walking along the Danube with pleasant temperatures
Visiting farmers markets for harvest produce
winter: Visiting the Christmas market at Hauptplatz
Enjoying the festive lights and atmosphere in the city center
Enjoying traditional Austrian food in cozy restaurants
Taking day trips to nearby ski resorts in Mühlviertel

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Ideal conditions, significant positive events, pleasant weather, potentially moderate crowds or peak festive season
scoreDescription.4: Good: Favorable conditions, good weather, possibly some key events, manageable or higher crowds (summer/Advent)
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard or transitional conditions, typical weather (can be cold/hot), fewer major events or public holidays with closures
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, potential for unfavorable weather (cold/damp), fewer activities
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Generally unfavorable conditions for typical tourism (rarely applicable)
